qas.question: The Piedmont is colder than the coast in what season?
What is the average winter daytime temperature in the Piedmont?
What do the temperatures often drop to at night in the piedmont region in the winter?
What is the average snowfall per year in Charlotte?
What type of precipitation is the Piedmont known for?

context: In <a0_0>winter<a0_0/>, the Piedmont is colder than the coast, with temperatures usually averaging in the <a1_0>upper 40s–lower 50s °F<a1_0/> (8–12 °C) during the day and often dropping <a2_0>below the freezing point<a2_0/> at night. The region averages around <a3_0>3–5 in<a3_0/> (8–13 cm) of snowfall annually in the Charlotte area, and slightly more north toward the Virginia border. The Piedmont is especially notorious for <a4_0>sleet and freezing rain<a4_0/>. Freezing rain can be heavy enough to snarl traffic and break down trees and power lines. Annual precipitation and humidity are lower in the Piedmont than in the mountains or the coast, but even at its lowest, the average is 40 in (1,020 mm) per year.
